questions.text: In the left ventricle, the blood flow in the subendocardium:

options.text: is much larger during the diastole than during the systole
the subendocardium is avascular, has no blood flow, this tissue is supplied by the blood within the heart chambers
is much larger during the systole than during the diastole
blood flow is equal in the subendocardium during the cardiac cycle

questions.text: In the left ventricle, the blood flow in the subendocardium:

options.text: is much larger during the diastole than during the systole
is much larger during the systole than during the diastole, this tissue is supplied by the blood within the heart chambers
is much larger during the systole than during the diastole
blood flow is equal in the subendocardium during the cardiac cycle
diastolic blood pressure
heart rate
right atrial pressure
duration of diastole
intrathoracic pressure
posture
does not depend on arterial blood pressure
is greatest during diastole
accounts for about 10% of the cardiac output
is regulated mainly by myocardial O2 consumption

questions.text: Cardiac work is composed of the followings:

options.text: volume work + pressure work
pressure work + acceleration work + volume work
acceleration work + volume work
pressure work + acceleration work
does not depend on arterial blood pressure
is regulated mainly by myocardial O2 consumption
is greatest during diastole
accounts for about 10% of the cardiac output

questions.text: The muscle cells of the left ventricle receive blood supply via the coronary arteries predominantly

options.text: during isometric contraction
during diastole
continuously during both systole and diastole
during rapid ejection
